doc.after: Gun turrets have been placed in static, land fortifications such as the Maginot Line forts in France and particularly in coastal artillery defences such as Fort Drum, the "concrete battleship", near Corregidor, Philippines and in Hitler's Atlantic Wall. Some of the artillery pieces in the Atlantic Wall fortifications such as the Cross-Channel guns where large naval guns housed in large turrets. Some nations, from Albania to Switzerland and Austria, have embedded the turrets of obsolete tanks in concrete bunkers.
